title: GST Basics üìö
ques: What is **GST** and what taxes did it replace?

answer.content:
**GST** (Goods and Services Tax): Comprehensive indirect tax on supply of goods and services

**Replaced**:
* Central: Excise Duty, Service Tax, CVD, SAD
* State: VAT, CST, Entertainment Tax, Luxury Tax, Entry Tax

**Implemented**: 1st July 2017

explanation: GST eliminates ***cascading effect*** of multiple taxes.

title: GST Structure üèõÔ∏è
ques: What are the **components of GST** in India?

answer.content:
**Components**:
* **CGST**: Central GST (Central Government)
* **SGST**: State GST (State Government)
* **IGST**: Integrated GST (Inter-state)
* **UTGST**: Union Territory GST

**Intra-state**: CGST + SGST
**Inter-state**: IGST

title: GST Registration üìã

answer.content:
**Mandatory Registration**:
* Turnover exceeds threshold (20 lakhs / 10 lakhs for special states)
* Inter-state supply
* E-commerce operators
* Casual taxable person
* Non-resident taxable person
* Persons required to deduct TDS/TCS

explanation: Registration within ***30 days*** of becoming liable.

title: Input Tax Credit üí∞
ques: What are the **conditions for claiming Input Tax Credit (ITC)**?

answer.content:
**Conditions**:
* Possess tax invoice/debit note
* Received goods/services
* Supplier has paid tax to government
* Filed return (GSTR-3B)
* Used for business purposes

**Blocked**: Personal use, motor vehicles (with exceptions)

explanation: ITC is ***heart of GST*** - ensures no cascading.

title: Time of Supply üìÖ
ques: What is the **time of supply** for goods and services?

answer.content:
**Goods**: Earlier of:
* Date of invoice
* Date of payment received
* Last date to issue invoice

**Services**: Earlier of:
* Date of invoice (if within prescribed time)
* Date of payment received

explanation: Time of supply determines ***when tax liability*** arises.

title: Place of Supply üó∫Ô∏è
ques: Why is **place of supply** important under GST?

answer.content:
**Importance**: Determines whether transaction is:
* Intra-state (CGST + SGST) or
* Inter-state (IGST)

**Rules differ for**: Goods with/without movement, services, imports, exports

explanation: Place of supply affects ***tax collection*** jurisdiction.

title: E-Way Bill üöö

answer.content:
**Required when**:
* Movement of goods > Rs. 50,000 value
* Inter-state/Intra-state supply
* Valid for distance-based period

**Exceptions**: Exempted goods, movement within 50 km

explanation: E-Way Bill ensures ***goods are tracked*** during transit.

title: GST Returns üìù
ques: What are the main **GST returns** to be filed?

answer.content:
**Returns**:
* **GSTR-1**: Outward supplies (monthly/quarterly)
* **GSTR-3B**: Summary return (monthly)
* **GSTR-9**: Annual return
* **GSTR-9C**: Reconciliation statement (if turnover > 5 crores)

title: Composition Scheme üìä
ques: What is the **Composition Scheme** under GST?

answer.content:
**Composition Scheme**:
* For small taxpayers (turnover < 1.5 crores)
* Pay fixed rate on turnover
* No ITC available
* Cannot make inter-state supplies
* Quarterly return (CMP-08)

**Rate**: 1-5% depending on type of supply

title: Reverse Charge Mechanism ‚ö°

answer.content:
**RCM Applies**:
* Notified goods/services
* Supplies from unregistered to registered person (for specified supplies)
* Import of services
* Legal services, GTA services, etc.

**Recipient pays tax**: Instead of supplier

explanation: RCM ensures ***tax collection*** where supplier may not be registered.

title: Exports and Zero Rating üåç

answer.content:
**Export Treatment** (Zero-rated):
* Export without payment of tax + claim ITC refund
* Export with payment of IGST + claim IGST refund

**LUT/Bond**: Letter of Undertaking for export without payment

explanation: Exports are ***zero-rated*** to make them tax-free.

answer.content:
**Audit Required**:
* Turnover > 5 crores (self-certified reconciliation)
* May be audited by department
* Special audit by CA/CMA (if ordered)

**Documents**: GSTR-9, GSTR-9C, reconciliation

title: Penalties and Offences ‚ö†Ô∏è
ques: What are the **penalties** for non-compliance under GST?

answer.content:
**Penalties**:
* Late filing: Rs. 50/day (Rs. 20 for NIL)
* Tax short-paid: 10% of tax or Rs. 10,000
* Fraud/Suppression: 100% of tax
* Wrong ITC: 100% of wrong credit

**Interest**: 18% p.a. on late payment

title: TDS and TCS under GST üí≥
ques: Who is required to **deduct TDS/TCS** under GST?

answer.content:
**TDS (1%)**:
* Government departments
* PSUs
* Local authority

**TCS (1%)**:
* E-commerce operators
* Collected from sellers on their behalf

**Anti-Profiteering**:
* Ensures benefit of rate reduction/ITC passed to consumers
* National Anti-Profiteering Authority (NAA)
* Can order price reduction, refund to consumers

**Complaints**: Can be filed by consumers/government
